revised_title: Measuring the Velocity of Electricity and the Duration of Electric Light
tldr: Wheatstone investigates the velocity of electricity and the duration of electric light using a revolving mirror and a series of experiments. He finds that the spark passes through the air and the metallic conductor in less than one-thousandth of a second, and that the duration of electric light at each point in its path can be determined by observing the reflected image in the mirror.
